concept.title: Data-driven testing at the test case level in

conbody.p: Data-driven testing (DDT) at the test case level allows you to add one or more data files and manage data binding at the test case level. It helps you keep the binding data in the test case independent, regardless of which test suites it is added to.

ul.li: Bind each test case to a fixed set of data.
Run a test case with different test data combinations.
When executing a test suite containing associated test cases, you can either reuse data binding at the test case level or conduct new data binding in a test suite.

conbody.p: Besides our currently supported data-driven testing methods, this feature also allows you to conduct data-driven testing in a dynamic test suite. To learn more about data-driven testing with dynamic test suites, you can refer to this document: Data-driven testing in a dynamic test suite.
